title: Acropolis briefly shuts down to protect Athens tourists from heat
description: Social workers handed out water to visitors after authorities closed the Acropolis in Greece for five hours during the hottest part of the day. Temperatures in southern Europe could hit record highs next week.

title: Pakistan’s military chief warns Afghan Taliban against harboring militants as attacks spike
description: Pakistan’s military chief warned the Afghan Taliban on Friday of an “effective response” by his forces if they fail to stop harboring militants who plot cross-border attacks from Afghanistan.

title: Haitians around the world call for action to stop gang violence
description: Thousands of supporters flooded the streets in nearly 70 countries to call on the international community to help curb the gang violence that has taken over Haiti.

title: World cycling's governing body bans transgender athletes from women's events
description: Female transgender athletes who transitioned after male puberty will no longer be able to compete in women’s races, world cycling governing body the UCI said.

title: Calls for action after teen vandalizes treasured Japanese temple
description: The pillar in the “Golden Hall” in Japan’s Toshodaji Temple has been in place for centuries.

title: Record-high waters force thousands to flee in India's capital
description: Rising floodwaters have forced thousands of New Delhi residents to flee their homes as torrential monsoon rains cause rivers in and near the Indian capital to overflow.

title: People in Thailand disappointed after popular prime minister hopeful loses vote
description: People in Bangkok were disappointed a prime minister hopeful Pita Limjaroenrat was defeated in a parliamentary vote. Pita, from the popular Move Forward Party, fell 51 votes short of the top job after being thwarted by a Senate appointed by the royalist military after a 2014 coup.

title: Watch: Thousands take part in the running of the bulls in northern Spain
description: As the San Fermin festival ends in Pamplona, Spain, thousands of runners dressed in white with red neckerchiefs took part in the famed running of the bulls. Tourists from all over the world come to northern Spain every year for the week-long festival to watch runners race through the half mile course chased by fighting bulls and steers.

title: Drone footage shows severe flooding in New Delhi after record rainfall
description: Drone footage shows severe flooding across New Delhi after record rainfall swelled water levels in the Yamuna River that runs through the city to a 45-year high. Since the monsoon season began in June, New Delhi has recorded 113% above-average rainfall, according to India’s Meteorological Department.

title: Guatemala's presidential election in turmoil as top political party suspended
description: Guatemala's presidential election has been thrown into chaos after a political party in favor of reform was suspended ahead of a major run-off election. NBC's Ellison Barber explains why citizens are feeling uncertain about their future amid the turmoil.
